page.title: 02Organising Keynsham Carnival
page.content: Keynsham Carnival took place on the afternoon of Saturday June 8th in 1985. The carnival is organised by Keynsham and District Round Table. The Round Table is a club which has 30 members (there are 1200 Round Tables in the United Kingdom). They try to use their skills and knowledge to help the community and have fun doing so. This year there were 40 floats in the procession with about 40 people on each float (a float is a decorated lorry). After the procession there was a fair in Cadbury's Ground. There were bouncy castles and barbecues, car displays and Majorettes etc. There was a parachute drop anf The Wurzels (a folk group) performed their music. They raised Â£3000 for local charities and estimated that 5000 people came to the carnival. This year was the 11th carnival organised by the Round Table.
